messages.title: Working hard for the Moorlands
messages.content: Trudie McGuinness is a local candidate born and raised in Biddulph. She joined the Labour Party at 18 and has a focus on social justice. With her experience as a director at South Staffordshire College, she champions education, training and employment, and has a background in safeguarding young people and vulnerable adults.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Commits to being there for you and your family when you need it, planning to secure the future of the NHS with 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 extra GPs, funded by a clamp down on tax avoidance, a levy on tobacco firms and a Mansion Tax.

Plans to guarantee a job or training out of work for a year for young people aged 18-24. Pledges to protect apprenticeships and aims to expand university places, making them more accessible to young people.
Labour will raise the minimum wage and ban zero-hours contracts, bring in rent controls, and freeze energy prices until 2017 to address economic inequality.

issues.economy: Labour will create a fairer economy for all.
issues.education: Labour will protect apprenticeships and expand university places.
issues.health: Labour will secure the future of the NHS with more nurses and GPs, funded by new taxes and levies.

politicalExperience.role: Labour councillor for Leek and Staffordshire

politicalExperience.achievements: Championing education, training and employment and safeguarding young people and vulnerable adults.

endorsements.endorsement: Trudie's commitment to the Staffordshire Moorlands is second to none. She is a strong voice for local people and has campaigned tirelessly to try and save our youth services, day centres, libraries and Sure Start centres.
She has lots of campaigning experience and lots of energy to help get the job done.
I know that Trudie is an incredibly dedicated campaigner and stands up for the many not the few. Living locally and caring as much as she does, she will be there for you as your MP.

images.caption: Trudie McGuinness with Councillor Charlotte Atkins.
Trudie McGuinness speaking at an event.
